intro: Omphalogramma farreri, commonly known as the Farrell's omphalogramma, is a rare flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants commonly known as buckwheats. The plant is characterized by its delicate, clustered inflorescences and small, greenish-white flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
